item.title: BDC Client: Ballard’s UI Interface Refresh
item.dc:creator: updikes@ymail.com
item.description:
Summer Time Problem: Redesign the user experience of Ballard’s reservation portal. Create a more user friendly approach in the design of the application and thus help with Ballard’s online conversion rates when reserving some of the services Ballard’s has to offer, such as a private Cabana. Soak in the Sun Solution: The end result was […]

The post BDC Client: Ballard’s UI Interface Refresh appeared first on Shawn Updike Web Developer.
item.content:encoded:
Summer Time

Problem:

Redesign the user experience of Ballard’s reservation portal. Create a more user friendly approach in the design of the application and thus help with Ballard’s online conversion rates when reserving some of the services Ballard’s has to offer, such as a private Cabana.

Soak in the Sun

Solution:

The end result was successful, the idea was passed off to Ballard’s after reviewing with BDC team, their next steps would be to develop this out through BDC to implement it in their day to day operations.

Big Waves

Process:

The initial approach when it came to redesigning the UX of their booking application was to go with a less is more mentality. Remove the clutter and make it very direct and simple for the user. Using Adobe XD to simulate the user journey and Ai to flesh out the overall design the road to bringing a fresh concept to Ballard’s was clear.

Goodbye, Good Riddance.

Problem:

Design a website that features an event or call to action that encourages the user to want to engage in the real-life event through an effective & simple marketing strategy presented through the micro-site. The Rolling Stone’s Bandemic Warp Tour is the embodiment of what being in your youth is all about.

Party Time!

Process:

Concept was rooted in the idea of putting on a live music event where collective artists from different genres would perform post pandemic that was organized by the Rolling Stones. Wire-frames & testing occurred in Adobe XD & later coded into a working site. The theme is within the name of the festival “Bandemic”, hence we need to band together afterwards together over music and festivities.

No Regrets.

Solution:

This site has very simple navigation and is completed functional via Javascript and JQuery with a concrete foundation in both HTML and Sass. This site was a success with the simplistic and edgy branding.

VISIT BANDEMIC WEBSITE
PreviousBDC Client: Falmouth Marine Website Rebuild

The post BDC Client: Ballard’s UI Interface Refresh appeared first on Shawn Updike Web Developer.

item.title: BDC Client: Falmouth Marine Website Rebuild
item.dc:creator: updikes@ymail.com
item.description:
Set Sail Problem: Rebuild Falmouth Marine’s existing site and refresh the user experience to be more compliant with current best practices in the site’s web design. Keeping the company’s brand standards in mind whilst updating the look and feel of the website. Full Sail Ahead Solution: The end result was successful, after review with BDC […]

The post BDC Client: Falmouth Marine Website Rebuild appeared first on Shawn Updike Web Developer.
item.content:encoded:
Set Sail

Problem:

Rebuild Falmouth Marine’s existing site and refresh the user experience to be more compliant with current best practices in the site’s web design. Keeping the company’s brand standards in mind whilst updating the look and feel of the website.

Full Sail Ahead

Solution:

The end result was successful, after review with BDC team, the newly renovated site was passed off to Falmouth Marine where they use it to this day. We received nothing but positive feedback after the hand off which is always great hear!

Ship Stern

Process:

When redesigning Falmouth’s site, the site’s identity was to remain the same with a better user journey throughout the site. This was accomplished by using newly provided imagery and utilizing Elementor in WordPress to rebuild page’s from the ground up in a modern format that would better represent what Falmouth Marine is all about.

Goodbye, Good Riddance.

item.title: BDC Client: Millers Franchise Website Rebuild
item.dc:creator: updikes@ymail.com
item.description:
May I take your order? Problem: Miller’s recently had a brand identity revamp, this new image brought more life and iconic element’s to their beloved franchise. With this, they approached BDC with a request to revamp their website to match their new and now current brand standards they we’re moving forward with. Order Up! Solution: […]

The post BDC Client: Millers Franchise Website Rebuild appeared first on Shawn Updike Web Developer.
item.content:encoded:
May I take your order?

Problem:

Miller’s recently had a brand identity revamp, this new image brought more life and iconic element’s to their beloved franchise. With this, they approached BDC with a request to revamp their website to match their new and now current brand standards they we’re moving forward with.

Order Up!

Solution:

The end result was an unusual one, we had many team meetings to both strategy and review different stages for where we stood in the project. In the end we ended up putting this project on hold, however to me this seems like a prominent project to feature nonetheless due to the complexity and scale of this project being both fun and challenging to work on in the end.

What's Cookin'?

Process:

There was a lot that need to be taken into account here. After they has provided their new standards and assets to us, we went right to work in curated web optimized assets and creating a library of elements to be used on the site. Afterwards we then moved to wire-framing and creating the skeleton of the new site. Once those we’re in place we built out the header, footer, main pages, sub-pages and child-pages alike to meet their deadline.

Goodbye, Good Riddance.

item.title: SFFI Web Redesign
item.dc:creator: updikes@ymail.com
item.description:
Make Ready.. Problem: Redesign an existing website that was created on WIX. Fix the website bugs, glitches and overall errors to being the site to a more usable and pleasant user experience. Set the site up in a simplistic four page boilerplate site structure to allow the user to navigate Safety First Firearms Instruction (SFFI) […]

The post SFFI Web Redesign appeared first on Shawn Updike Web Developer.
item.content:encoded:
Make Ready..

Problem:

Redesign an existing website that was created on WIX. Fix the website bugs, glitches and overall errors to being the site to a more usable and pleasant user experience. Set the site up in a simplistic four page boilerplate site structure to allow the user to navigate Safety First Firearms Instruction (SFFI) seamlessly.

Fire!

Solution:

I hadn’t used WIX since the early days when it was released to the public, it was the most prudent way of going about redesigning a site but I wanted to help Dave out based on his wishes, the site is complete with simple navigation, later on Dave has said he wants to do more with his site utilizing WordPress, to which I can’t wait for the real fun to begin.

Take Aim.

Process:

The approach to fixing this site was simple but incorporated modern web design strategies. Dave Vergilis, Owner / Instructor at SFFI, wanted his site to be his main hub of info about his practice. Nothing fancy with SEO enhancements or eye-catching lottie animations but a simple site to house his info. For myself this was a simple walk in the park. He requested the we make the edits to his site in WIX which I was okay doing, but know what can really be done out there on the web, it was limited potential.

Goodbye, Good Riddance.

No Regrets.

VISIT SFFI WEBSITE

item.title: Fruit Basket E-Com Website
item.dc:creator: updikes@ymail.com
item.description:
Starting From Scratch… Problem: Develop a brand image and online platform where partnering school districts can have their students make an online account and trade items with other students from other districts in which Fruit Basket fulfills the delivery of said items to the student. Setup each students account to be customizable with their name, […]

The post Fruit Basket E-Com Website appeared first on Shawn Updike Web Developer.
item.content:encoded:
Starting From Scratch...

Problem:

Develop a brand image and online platform where partnering school districts can have their students make an online account and trade items with other students from other districts in which Fruit Basket fulfills the delivery of said items to the student. Setup each students account to be customizable with their name, school and create a carrot reward system that teachers can use to incentive students to do better in their classes. In short, an e-commerce platform without any exchange of currency and strictly have it setup like an online bartering system.

Bon Appetite

Solution:

Fruit Basket came together in a very non-linear fashion but it got built from the ground up with nothing more than a vision. The execution of the project took about two months to erect but had a successful conclusion. It stands as one of my most challenging endeavors to date.

Groundwork

Process:

With a very specific ask, I knew I would have to approach this project from a much less traditional angle. Owner, Donald White came to me with a vision of a brand and online forum that would allow students to online trade. Producing the foundation his brand in Illustrator and hosting and building his website through WordPress, the groundwork was laid down to really get the real work going. Donald and I would meet routinely to discuss and strategize the structure of the website and how he wanted it to function. There were several setbacks but they came with solutions.

Goodbye, Good Riddance.
